articles.headline: Complaint Says Hsu Admitted Fraud
articles.snippet: Prosecutors said Norman Hsu, the Democratic fund-raiser, confessed to F.B.I. agents that he had swindled investors.
articles.abstract: Prosecutors said Norman Hsu, the Democratic fund-raiser, confessed to F.B.I. agents that he had swindled investors.
articles.lead_paragraph: Norman Hsu, the Democratic fund-raiser with a habit of fleeing the law, confessed to F.B.I. agents last week that he had swindled investors in what the government describes as a multimillion-dollar Ponzi scheme, and acknowledged pressuring at least some of them to contribute to political campaigns, prosecutors said in a criminal complaint unsealed yesterday.
articles.byline: By Alan Feuer and Mike McIntire

articles.headline: Helped by Generics, Inflation of Drug Costs Slows
articles.snippet: Annual inflation in drug costs is at the lowest rate in three decades as generic versions of some of the most common drugs have recently come on the market.
articles.abstract: Annual inflation in drug costs is at the lowest rate in three decades as generic versions of some of the most common drugs have recently come on the market.
articles.lead_paragraph: As overall health care costs continue to rise sharply, prescription drugs have emerged as a surprising exception.

articles.headline: Illegal Immigrants Chase False Hope to Canada
articles.snippet: Illegal immigrants to the United States have been arriving in a Canadian border town looking for asylum.
articles.abstract: Illegal immigrants to the United States have been arriving in a Canadian border town looking for asylum.
articles.lead_paragraph: WINDSOR, Ontario, Sept. 20 — Fleeing stepped-up sweeps by the American authorities, illegal immigrants to the United States, mostly Mexican, are arriving in growing numbers at the foot of the bridge in this Canadian border town seeking refugee status.
articles.byline: By Monica Davey and Abby Goodnough

articles.headline: Dollar Falls to New Low Against the Euro
articles.snippet: The euro traded above $1.40 for the first time since the common European currency was introduced.
articles.abstract: The euro traded above $1.40 for the first time since the common European currency was introduced.
articles.lead_paragraph: Investors dumped dollars yesterday, sending the euro to a record high and putting the American currency at par with the Canadian dollar for the first time in more than 30 years.
articles.byline: By Vikas Bajaj and Ian Austen

articles.headline: Viacom Chief’s Remark on Spielberg Stirs a Furor
articles.snippet: Despite stellar success at the box office, the relationship between DreamWorks and its corporate parent, Viacom, appears once again to be on the rocks.
articles.abstract: Despite stellar success at the box office, the relationship between DreamWorks and its corporate parent, Viacom, appears once again to be on the rocks.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 20 — Philippe P. Dauman, the chief executive of Viacom, told an investment conference on Tuesday that his company and its Paramount Pictures and DreamWorks units would do just fine, even if DreamWorks lost the services of Steven Spielberg.

articles.headline: Carlyle to Sell Stake to a Mideast Government
articles.snippet: The government of Abu Dhabi will take a stake in the buyout firm, a reflection of the growing financial power of the oil-rich Middle East.
articles.abstract: The government of Abu Dhabi will take a stake in the buyout firm, a reflection of the growing financial power of the oil-rich Middle East.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Carlyle Group, the buyout firm, agreed yesterday to sell a minority stake to the Abu Dhabi government in a deal that reflects the growing financial power of the oil-rich Middle East.

articles.headline: Accord Seen on Revising Mortgage Rules
articles.snippet: The Bush administration is softening its opposition to proposals that would expand government-backed mortgage companies ahead of an expected wave of foreclosures.
articles.abstract: The Bush administration is softening its opposition to proposals that would expand government-backed mortgage companies ahead of an expected wave of foreclosures.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 20 — The Bush administration, bracing for a tidal wave of home foreclosures by people with subprime mortgages, is softening its opposition to Democratic proposals to expand the giant government-sponsored mortgage finance companies.

articles.headline: Guards’ Shots Not Provoked, Iraq Concludes
articles.snippet: Iraq’s Ministry of Interior is proposing a major reshaping of how American diplomats in Iraq are protected.
articles.abstract: Iraq’s Ministry of Interior is proposing a major reshaping of how American diplomats in Iraq are protected.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, Sept. 20 — Iraq’s Ministry of Interior has concluded that employees of a private American security firm fired an unprovoked barrage in the shooting last Sunday in which at least eight Iraqis were killed and is proposing a radical reshaping of the way American diplomats and contractors here are protected.
articles.byline: By Sabrina Tavernise and James Glanz

articles.headline: In 9/11 Chaos, Giuliani Forged a Lasting Image
articles.snippet: Rudolph W. Giuliani’s conduct during and after the  attacks brought him back from the edge of irrelevancy.
articles.abstract: Rudolph W. Giuliani’s conduct during and after the  attacks brought him back from the edge of irrelevancy.
articles.lead_paragraph: That first tower toppled at 9:59 a.m., a billion pounds of steel and concrete and bodies raining down. Smoke billowed like thunderheads, and New York’s mayor seemed to disappear into death’s maw.

articles.headline: The Week of Saying Never Mind
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve releases two papers that provide insights into its thinking on inflation and the slumping dollar.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve releases two papers that provide insights into its thinking on inflation and the slumping dollar.
articles.lead_paragraph: “When somebody persuades me I am wrong, I change my mind. What do you do?”
